pull.title: ci: switch to LLVM 20 in tidy job
pull.body: Switch to LLVM 20 in the tidy job.

events.body:

| Concept ACK | [kevkevinpal](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32226#issuecomment-2781162340), [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32226#issuecomment-2804977437) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28710](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28710) (Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Concept ACK 

I manually reviewed the tidy changes and they looked good to me. I think upgrading to LLVM 20 is a good upgrade

Looks like `CI / test each commit` is failing but seems unrelated to the changes made

The reason why the `CI / test each commit` is failing

```
(PR32226) bitcoin $ git merge --no-commit origin/master
Already up to date.
(PR32226) bitcoin $ git merge --abort
fatal: There is no merge to abort (MERGE_HEAD missing).
```

I love it when new tidy checks are added, it avoids a lot of needless review churn!

It seems to me the current replacements enable a few other simplifications - and we can likely apply the same logic manually to a few places that weren't found by tidy, e.g:

#### Can be replaced with `starts_with`
* `if (str.substr(0, 3) == std::string("OP")) {` https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/core_write.cpp#L56
* `if (key.substr(0, 5) == "-psn_") continue;` https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/common/args.cpp#L192
* `QVERIFY(result.substr(0,1) == "{");` https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/test/rpcnestedtests.cpp#L67-L73
* `if (str.substr(0, prefix.size()) == prefix) {` https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util/string.h#L171

#### Can be replaced with `ends_with`
* if (str.size() >= 2 && str.substr(str.size() - 2) == "==") str.remove_suffix(2);` https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/util/strencodings.cpp#L186-L188

events.body: @l0rinc I've taken some of these, but I'm not planning on making further refactors here, just updating the infra. Happy to review a followup.

comments.body: nit: These changes seem related to the ones in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31306 (might be worth mentioning in the comment or PR description like we did with the previous commit)

If it starts with "no" we already know that `str.size() >= 2`.
This seems like a premature optimization to avoid doing the substring - but regardless, I don't think it's needed:
```suggestion
                if (str.starts_with("no")) {
```

since we've already checked that the length has to be 8+4, we might as well match the end here:
```suggestion
            path.ends_with(".dat"))
```

I knew that the first parameter would throw if it's out of rage, but wasn't sure what `substr` did for shorter length strings (since I know `starts_with` would work for empty string, but `2` would be out of range), but the doc states:
> len
Number of characters to include in the substring (if the string is shorter, as many characters as possible are used).

And tried it and they both return `false` for empty or short string: 👍
